analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have increased across the UK over the last five years. The +11.9% change compared to a change of +8.6% in all GCSE entries over the last five years. Over the same period, the 16-year-old population has changed by approximately 0.8%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in art and design subjects in 2020 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 86.5% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in art and design subjects compared to 76.3% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have increased sharply across the UK over the last five years. The +23.5% change compared to a change of +8.6% in all GCSE entries over the last five years. Over the same period, the 16-year-old population has changed by approximately 0.8%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in biology in 2020 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 94.6% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in biology compared to 76.3% for all subjects.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in business and communication systems in 2020 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 85.7% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in business and communication systems compared to 76.3% for all subjects.

Entries in all subjects have increased by 8.6% across the UK over the last five years. Over the same period, the 16-year-old population has increased by approximately +0.8%.

Across the UK, 76.3% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in all subjects in 2020.
